info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 5:29PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Kern County through 600 PM PDT... At 528 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Tehachapi moving northwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tehachapi, Golden Hills, Stallion Springs, Mojave and Water Canyon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
